results.description: This meetup group is the Boston chapter of Medicine X (http://medicinex.stanford.edu). Medicine X is a catalyst for new ideas about the future of medicine and health care. The initiative explores how emerging technologies will advance the practice of medicine, improve health, and empower patients to be active participants in their own care. Such emerging technologies include those that are: largely digital (e.g., online peer-to-peer healthcare communities, wearables); • methodological (e.g., human-centered design and innovation, service design); • cultural (e.g., participatory medicine, doctors and patients functioning as designers); • and more. This group is intended to bring together (e)patients, healthcare providers, experience designers, technologists, and researchers. The group will offer opportunities to hear from key members of these communities, experience emerging technologies, collaborate on projects, and more. Contact the organizer(s) if you want to volunteer to speak at a meeting or recommend speakers. Contact the organizer(s) also if you are interested in providing a venue for meetings or in being a meetup sponsor, or if you would like to recommend possibilities for either.
results.name: Medicine X - Boston Area

If your answer is yes, then this is the perfect group for you! 

I am a professional landscape photographer, and I specialize in running North American and international  photography workshops and tours. For a sample of my work, please feel free to peruse my portfolio.

South Africa's spectacular coast line. Join me on a photo tour and workshop to one of the world's most jaw dropping beautiful coastlines! 


I am also running a unique conservation photography initiative where you have the opportunity to contribute directly, through your photography, to nature conservation, and at the same time improve your photography skills. To find out more about this initiative, please visit here.

The Canadian Rockies are a must visit destination for all  North American landscape and nature photographers. I will take you there! 


I look forward to exploring our world's spectacular wild lands with you and helping you take your photography to the next level! 

Kind regards,

Christoph

results.description:
Come to Toastmasters which is a safe place to practice practice your public speaking. Guests to meetings are welcome. To give a scheduled speech guests would need to join Toastmasters. We will announce various places at MIT where you can attend Toastmasters. 

Please view the Pages section for the meeting times and information of the various Toastmasters meetings.  

Here's a sample agenda for our meeting (most of Toastmasters at MIT follow similar agendas):

6:15 PM Setting up/Networking

6:30 PM President's Greeting and Club announcements

Welcome all to the MIT Tuesday Toastmasters.

Toastmaster's Welcome 

Introduces each role, its purpose, and the person who will perform the role.

Humorist/Joke

Starts the meeting on a light-hearted note.

Word of the Day

Encourages each of us to add a new word to our vocabularies. Challenge us to use the new word spontaneously.

Thought of Day

Club member gives short thought of the day.

Scheduled Speeches 

Club members give the speeches that they've scheduled and prepared in advance using the guidelines from one of the Toastmasters International communication manuals.

Table Topics

Our meeting's Topicsmaster provides our members and guests with an opportunity for demonstrating and honing their skills for impromptu speaking.

General Evaluator's Introduction 

Introduces evaluation team members and evaluate the evaluators and the meeting in general.

Speech Evaluations 

Club members provide helpful, supportive feedback to each of the scheduled speaker in a positive and friendly manner.

Ah-Counter's Report

Ah-counter reports how many filler-words and false starts were used by each participant, to raise speakers' awareness of these instances and to encourage improvement. 

Timer's Report

Timer reports speaking times of all major speaking roles to encourage members learn to accomplish tasks within set time limits.

Toastmasters Closing Remarks

President

Ask for volunteers for roles and speeches for the next week.

Please visit our website for more information.

http://web.mit.edu/personnel/toastmasters/
results.name: Toastmasters MIT

It is hard on our own. We meet because we can learn from and encourage each other. Together it is easier. results.description:
Welcome to the “Single's Life Journey – A Higher Love Singles Group” This is not your average Singles group. Here we will talk about the things that most people are afraid to talk about. So please read carefully before you decide to join.

Being Single shouldn't mean being alone.

The Heart and Purpose of this group is to explore the Single’s life journey. This group is where we can come together to reflect on each and every aspect of being Single, express our true authentic emotions (painful, shameful, joyful and all) and support each other in creating a fulfilled holistic life - emotionally, financially, intellectually, spiritually and practically. We will also look into information that will help us to create a genuine-sacred-spiritual partnership. There will be several meetups on various different topics and we will have market experts in those areas come and share their expertise with us. This is our safe place to be.


Who is this group for:

·  Single Heterosexual, Single Gay, Single Lesbian, Single Divorced, Single Widowed

·  All ages and ethnicities welcome

·  People who are ready to go deep emotionally and spiritually

·  People who are ready for spirituality, healing, growth and transformation

·  People who are ready and willing to be honest and vulnerable

·  People who are honest and committed

·  People who are interested in creating a genuine tribe to belong to


Who is this group NOT for:

·  People who are not ready for deep conversations and transformations

·  People who are just cruising for dates

·  People who just want to meet other single people

·  People who are looking to kill their free time

·  People who RSVP but then don’t show up --- After 2 no shows you will be removed from the group.


Some of the topics that we will talk about:

·  How does it really feel to be single?

·  What social stigma do we face in being single?

·  What familial or cultural pressures do we face

·  Do you have a genuine community that you belong to?

·  How can we release the Shame and Pain of being single

·  How can we invoke our Divine Power and Purpose within 

·  Vacation, Holidays – Nightmare or Fun?

·  Home ownership process for a Single person

·  Financial stability for a Single person

·  Can you create a family if you are single

·  How does our Familial and Ancestral issues block us in love

·  Past lovers and relationships – Do we just surgically remove them from our heart?

·  Lessons from our past relationships

·  Become Happy Now instead of Happily Ever-After 

·  Create our own genuine tribe and friendships

·  How do you create a Higher, Deeper, Sacred Love relationship


What does being single mean to you? Does this sound familiar -- You often feel like you don’t fit in, like you're out of place, like something is wrong with you. All your friends are married or coupled up. Social and Family events are not fun. Even with all your professional success, something is still missing... In this group we'll explore how to let go of the shame of being single, how you can regain your freedom and purpose. How you can take control of your narrative. How to plant your own roots and create your own tribe. How you can start being Happy NOW.
results.name: Single's Life Journey

Hi Thinkers:

The goal is simple. We want to collectively develop and expand our mental ability.

To do this will require four Cognitive Science insights: (1) brain, (2) mind, (3) consciousness, and (4) judging intent by situation. In short, we will define and detail the thinking skill needed to become more competent at any thinking task.

If you feel that advanced thought development and implementation is a strategic part of your career future, then come join our efforts. If you share our vision, and will work to help, then you are most welcomed; regardless of the current thinking skill level.

results.description:
Does TensorFlow have the potential to become the engine behind most successful consumer and industrial products of the next 10-20 years? 

Absolutely! A much better question is how, and in what new ways, can we:

a) train more computers to teach themselves by sifting through massive amounts of data coming out of all sorts of places

b) make these computers available through an API to provide a high-quality answer to anyone who is in need. 

Why? Because everyone in need deserves the right answer. 

So.... why don't we standardize & democratize the field with and around TensorFlow, and help change the world!?

What. We are a local micro community of those interested in advancing their knowledge of TensorFlow, its use cases and applications.

How. Join our group for a regular dose of human interaction, conversations, smiles, food and drinks on all things TensorFlow:

• How-To's & Best Practices

• Tutorials

• Models

• Algorithms

• Multi-GPU Autoscaling in the cloud

• Tools & Integrations

We will learn how others solve some of the hard problems that exist in the world around us, and how others make predictive APIs and  applications 

Join the movement. Let’s change the world. 

Because everyone in need deserves the right answer.

You are welcome:)
results.name: TensorFlow Boston

On occasion, a live band will play music to accompany the dancing. We are reviving the tradition of the legendary gay women’s dance parties that set the Boston women’s night scene ablaze for almost a decade back in the 90’s. Our parties will take place in the same beautiful and spacious venue: The Sons of Italy hall in Winchester, MA and other dance studios we like in the Boston area. 

We certainly hope that you will enjoy the dance events that we are providing for queer women. We are looking for active members who will participate in our events. We want a real-world dance community to bring to life our virtual, online meetup. We are striving to create memorable nights filled with great music, socializing in a relaxed atmosphere, and good times. So turn it on, crank it up and let your rainbow flag fly. Please join our events and spread the word!

Dawn & Lena

results.description:
We get together to create community of people who share the skill of empathic abilities. You don't have to convince others of your abilities as everyone in the group has those abilities.

Let's discuss the desirable side of having these skills and share discoveries how to improve them.  Current written scientific information on mirror-touch synesthesia is about being uncomfortable with these abilities.  Having emapthic abilities is a skill and a skill can be improved and modified to fit the need.  Let's share discoveries that work.

Recent publications on the topic of mirror-touch synesthesia state that those having these abilities don't know how to feel sensations in their own body.  I find that the empathic abilities can be fine tuned so that you choose what to experience, yourself or others.

We get together, share the good side of empathy, pass on insights to better understand the phenomenon to others.

We will start each group with laughter.  How to allow laughter is a skill.  It gets you in the mood not to be overly serious.
results.name: mirror-touchsynesthesia

We will try to do volunteer work every Sunday. In addition, we will meet a couple of times a month to discuss strategy, brain storm, discuss bigger problems and outline potential solutions to each of those problems (Ex. a focus on education from an early age will result in productive future citizens. results.description:
"FRIENDS HELPING FRIENDS MAKE BUSINESS CONNECTIONS" - J.Z.


Calling all Entrepreneurs, Business Owners and those who dream of running their own venture!


If you desire to expand your business network, make more friends, find new customers and become a leader in your community, we have a fun and informal social networking group that is just right for you.


We'll have monthly meetings at coffee shops or neighbourhood bars in and around town to connect with others & learn "best practice" sales, marketing, finance and time management tactics and strategies from your city’s top entrepreneurs.


The Smart Success Business Network is a community run by volunteers with 101 Meetup groups in 101 cities across Australia, Canada, New Zealand, the United Kingdom and United States. 


MOST EVENTS ARE FREE AND ALL BUSINESS OWNERS & MANAGERS ARE WELCOME.


No attendance commitment required.
• You can arrive and leave on your schedule.
• No elevator pitches in front of the group required.
• Informal bar/restaurant meetings in the evenings.
• Most meetups are between Tuesdays & Thursdays.
• No long sit down meals next to strangers. 


 Our mission is to encourage business success by recruiting small business owners to give group talks to their peers, potential customers and suppliers and new entrepreneurs to share their expertise and offer words of support and encouragement to their community. 


 We are also known as a "Pay it Forward" group. You might find your ideal client/customer here in your first meetup but it's more likely you will meet someone who can benefit from goods & services offered by your friends.


By networking to help other business owners and recommending products or services by other members, the benefits of increased sales accumulate to everyone in the group.


Benefits of networking with us:


You will learn how to avoid unprofitable markets, attract the right customers, block negative critical thinking, be both effective and efficient, understand cash flow and much more.


Though powerful stories and proven strategies, you will learn how to boldly harness your creative force, break free of fear and get your life and business aligned with your values and the market's needs.


With the right knowledge and support, you can design a life and business that embodies strength and boldness that you know you are capable of. See you at one of our meetings soon.

topics.name: Making a True Change in Our Local Politics

results.description:
"You never change something by fighting the existing reality. To change something, build a new model that makes the existing model obsolete."  - Buckminster Fuller

Town Hall is an old New England tradition going back four centuries, that involved true democratic participation of all citizens in their community's social and political decisions.  

In  the 21st century in Newton Massachusetts we do not have a system of democratic participation. Newton politics is run by an insular political clique who do not truly welcome citizen participation. They view any citizens who attempt to participate in the political process as a nuisance. 

The politicians will perform a pantomime of allowing citizen participation, but it's just a sham, and they will end up doing whatever they intended to do all along, after they finish their charade or pretending to listen to feedback from the public. 

Newton's politicians do not care what is best for the community, and they certainly don't care what any of the citizens think about anything. What they care about is their own positions of power, the business dealings that are at the root of all their decisions, and the status symbols of their titles.

If you've ever attempted to get involved in Newton politics at any level you will probably recognize the truth of the above paragraph. You may also have come to the realization of the futility of expecting to ever be able to change the way things are run in Newton politics.

The idea of NewTown Hall is to start from scratch, to scrap the established way of running decisions, and try to envision what a truly democratic and reasonable form of local government would be. This must be a form of interaction where everyone has the right to be heard, and truly listened to, and where decisions are based on reason, sense, logic, and commitment to what is genuinely best for the community.

The manners of behavior and procedure that are conducted by the current political system must be discarded, because these behaviors and procedures clearly do not work in favor of the goals of true democracy. These behaviors are designed only to maintain the power dynamics of the politicians, to keep them powerful and you powerless.

To begin with, then, we must dispense with the insincere behaviors of handshaking, gavel-wielding, and applause. 

NewTown Hall must create a model of how local government ought to be conducted. We will develop this on our own, as ordinary citizens, without the participation of the politicians. We won't need to beg for their permission or approval, because this is something we will do on our own, separate from their procedures and outside of their jurisdiction to dictate to us how we can and cannot act.

NewTown Hall will be an alternative, ad hoc, non-binding self-government system.


For more on the concept of Buckminster Fuller:

http://www.davidmcelroy.org/?p=18991

"We can't defeat the existing system; we must build a better one instead".
results.name: NewTown Hall

results.description:
This group is a birthplace of Bokatai Kickboxing Federation. We are opening the door to all Martial Arts specialists and enthusiasts of stand-up styles of fighting to become a part of the federation. 

Through the centuries, on every continent, there were warriors who put their bodies and spirit through vigorous training to become masters of the art of war - to become masters of Martial Arts.

Each fighting style was created by the code of honor and has the rules of engagement. Those rules and the code were cherished through centuries, passing the secrets from a master to a student.  

All major fighting styles such as: Karate, Tae Kwon Do, Kung Fu, Muay Thai and Western Boxing are very well recognized in the present world.

Everyone has their own opinion on which style is more powerful, dominating and most destructive. But the truth is that every single style has advantages and disadvantages, every single style has strong points and weak points.

To close the gap, the Bokatai Kickboxing style was born. It fuses the best of Muay Thai, Boxing, Karate, TKD and Kung Fu to keep the evolution moving forward.

StackiLab Boston is a meetup for those interested in learning about Stacki, server provisioning, configuration management, and DevOps. This group is for everyone- both Stacki users and beginners to Stacki- you don't need to have any prior experience! Stacki is an open source CentOS/RHEL bare metal provisioning tool that can take your servers from bare hardware (or virtual hardware) to working Linux, ready to install applications. Stacki does this at scale, so deploying 1000+ servers is no more complex than deploying one. Once your servers are installed with Stacki, you can augment them with configuration tools like Puppet, Chef, Salt, CFEngine, Ansible, etc. 


Visit www.stacki.com to learn more. And join the Stacki community here: 

https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/stacki

Code of Conduct: I expect that all members treat the leadership team and other members with utmost respect. You will be expected to follow the Platinum Rule: treat others as they would want to be treated. This rule also extends to any staff or volunteers we interact with.

Attendance Policy: If you RSVP "yes" to an event, you are expected to attend. If for any reason you are unable to attend, please change your RSVP to "no". For events with a waitlist, at least 24 hours notice is requested when RSVPing "no" in order to be fair to those on the waitlist. No-shows will not be tolerated. Three no-shows will result in immediate removal from the group.

Photo Policy: Your photo must contain a clear view of your face. We must be able to recognize you at events based on your photo.

The leadership team reserves the right to remove any member for failure to adhere to these policies.

results.description: Are you searching for meaning in your life? Have you ever felt happiness in your life... ...never lasts? This Buddhist group has a great positive, multi-cultural atmosphere that helps people search for the answer to life's biggest questions. Through the teachings of Buddha and historical Pure Land Buddhist teachers we understand better the direction our life needs to take in order to find the purpose of life. We offer video lectures and have meetings to discuss how to obtain an absolute form of happiness. I hope you'll stop by and attend a meeting when you have a chance! Below, you'll find some more information about what Buddhism is all about as well as our contact info and location. In Buddhism, we learn that there are two kinds of joy. Relative Happiness All the happiness we know is called Relative Happiness. Money, status, fame, wealth, family, friends, and our loved ones are all included in this category. Politics, economics, medicine, and the arts also try to provide us with Relative happiness. We seek for this type of happiness day in, day out hoping we can attain true satisfaction from it. Absolute Happiness We are all seeking for a happiness which will truly last. This kind of happiness is called Absolute Happiness. The purpose of life is to attain it as quickly as possible while still alive. Learn more at our meetups and check out some of our topics: The Law of Cause and Effect Six Good Deeds that Bring Happiness Mirror of Truth Dark Mind is the Root Cause of Suffering
results.name: Boston "Why We Live?" in Buddhism Meetup

results.description:
Have you seriously pondered about what brings about a change in consciousness? What is it that leads to inner transformation within us, and outer transformation in our communities? This is a secular group that is committed to dialogue, inquiry and reflection on how can we bring about change within ourselves and how to peacefully influence our societies which is beset with violence and conflicts. We will meet at different locations in Boston, at libraries, cafes, public areas, etc. 

In this group, we will not dismiss spirituality for science, nor belittle the value of scientific research and inquiry for meditating and "knowing". But we accept as truth only that what works for us at an individual level. Regardless of whether you are an experienced meditator or a novice, we welcome all who have the desire to investigate, beyond their path and faith. If these words resonate with you, then this may just be the group where you feel most at home. 

Announcement of location will be made a week in advance. Initial meeting sessions, for meditations and dialogues, will be guided by Chris Mayya, who spent several years in monasteries of different traditions and has a background of growing up and training both in the East and the west. You can find out more about his current work at www.transformativeinquiry.org 

He is also involved with volunteer coaching sessions for teens and young people on "Attention-Awareness," and Life Skills training. He blogs on HuffingtonPost: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/chris-mayya/

results.description:
Boston-centric lightsaber stage combat group. We meet to develop, practice, and perform stage combat using lightsaber props; our mission is to provide a safe and fun performance for the audience while having a ball of fun ourselves!

Core values: 

1, safety safety safety. You are responsible for your safety, your partner's safety, and the audience's safety.

2, inclusiveness. We welcome everyone and expect everyone to contribute to a welcoming environment: abusive, insulting, harassing, or intimidating behavior will not be tolerated.

3, sharing. Come to learn, come to teach! We all have experience from different walks of life: come share what you know and learn from others. If you are here to work with people to make both of you look awesome at stage combat, you're in the right place. Those who want to pump up their ego about how cool a fighter they are, need not attend.

This group is focused on stage combat, which is a different creature than actual combat techniques. Also, this group is neutral about cosplay: some people might wish to have costumes that are 501st Legion/Rebel Legion approved, some people may want to do crossovers, some people may have no interest in cosplay. Lastly, we are not an RP group, although many of our members are heavily involved in other RP groups. We're just here to focus on the stage combat involving lightsabers.

FAQ:

"Do I need a lightsaber to attend?"

Nope! We have loaners.

"How often do you meet?"

Every Thursday night. We are currently holding practices at MIT's campus. http://whereis.mit.edu/?go=m34 We are slowly moving towards having additional Saturday practices for those who can't come during the week, but that may not happen for awhile.

"Are there any fees?"

No charges for anything.

"Where can I find more info?"

Our homepage is www.bostonjedi.org and we also have a Facebook group you can join: https://www.facebook.com/groups/768206489869545/
results.name: Boston Jedi

results.description:
Aren’t we responsible, forever, for what we have tamed?

A better question is:

a) How do we enable equal access to artificial intelligence, without proprietary source code which benefits just a small group of powerful overlords?

b) How do we ensure that, in the process of discovering artificial intelligence, humanity as a whole, including corporations and governments, does not create something which cannot be controlled?

c) How do we train more computers to teach themselves by sifting through massive amounts of data coming out of from all sorts of places,?

d) How do we democratize access to these computers through a universal open API to provide a high-quality answers to anyone who is in need

Join our group for a regular dose of human interaction, conversations, smiles, food and beverages on all things OpenAI.

We will learn how others solve some of the hard problems that exist in the world around us, how others make predictive APIs and applications, and how OpenAI evolves to fulfill its mission.

Aren’t we responsible, forever, for what we have tamed? Join the movement. Let’s change the world.

You are welcome:)
results.name: OpenAI Boston

results.description:
Hardware is dead. Long live hardware!

There is no question that hardware has been white-hot these past few years. Exits such as Nest and Oculus Rift are just some of the more recent data points in why hardware is hot.

There is plenty that we know about hardware. We know for instance that hardware is hard. We know that mass manufacturing is fraught with difficulty. We know that the proliferation of Adruinos and Raspberry Pis have lowered the barrier to hardware entry.

We also know that not all hardware is the same. Certainly something like the Nest Thermostat is intrinsically different from something like the hoverboard, even though both are fundamentally made up of the same components, such as a processing unit, PCB board & assembly, sensors, casing, etc.

What is it about the Nest Thermostat, or even the Autonomous Car that sets it apart from the "onesy" pieces of hardware such as the hoverboards or "dumb" cars?

The answer, IMHO, is the Connectivity and Intelligence that is built into one set of devices versus the other. A Connected and Intelligent device is more than just a piece of hardware -- it has the capacity to learn from its peer-device, change its behavior over time, and become integrated into- rather than just be added onto- a consumer's life. 

Connected & Intelligent devices have requirements that extend those which we traditionally think of as being "merely" hardware. On top of everything from the traditional component selection, prototyping, manufacturing, etc., each of these devices now also has to contend with issues such as privacy, security, networking, authentication, etc.

This difference, again IMHO, is what sets apart the Hardware 2.0 era of Smart Home, Smart City, and Smart AllSortsOfThings from their predecessors. The Boston Connected & Intelligent Device Meetup is intended to be a platform for discussion, design, growth, and promotion of such devices.
results.name: Boston Connected & Intelligent Device Meetup

Why you should join:

To learn, share, and have fun. And relieve your feelings of isolation in a delusional society.

Typical activities will be discussions, walks, visits to museums, and collective internet surfing.


Further description of this group:

It is a group for people who have come to the realization that our whole society is false and based on lies, mostly calculated lies, sometimes simply unintentional. That our society's foundation on phony beliefs and insincere attitudes is the cause of the existence and prevalence of hypocrisy throughout this society.
If you are desperate to meet other clear-thinking, rational, perceptive, and especially NON-DELUSIONAL people, please join this group so we may begin 2016 and beyond at least not feeling totally isolated from others like ourselves.

Here's a list of red flags against you joining this group:
1. If you believe there are "UFO" aliens living among us, turn back now. You're delusional
2. If you believe in god as anything other than a fanciful metaphor for the energy of the universe, this group is also not for you.
3. If you're a drug advocate, if you want marijuana legalized for any purposes other than strict and genuine medical necessity, this group is not for you. Go have a lovely day, elsewhere. 
4. If you're a believer in charities and volunteering, be prepared to have your beliefs and values questioned if you choose to join this group. In fact, everyone who joins this group should be prepared to have their ingrained beliefs and values questioned.


It's 2016. Your world is filled with magical incredible computerized gadgets, incredible inventions of genius and determination.And at the same time you are surrounded by hordes of incredibly ignorant, unthinking, apathetic zombies engaged in an unconvincing pantomime of being human beings.You need a sanctuary, an oasis in this modern intellectual and emotional desert. If enough of us can gather together, perhaps we can create that oasis.

results.description: This is a group focused on the pursuit of an alternative to dogmatic thinking. It is the opportunity for believers and non believers to get together and share their philosophical views on existentialism, share their struggles in the defiance towards status quo or peer influence, and find happiness through open mindedness, volunteer work and other sorts of humanism. I developed a philosophical posture in life called Igocentrism. Science has shown us how the three main sources of happiness are the so called Intrinsic Sources: self growth, relationships and the giving to others. However, society is negatively impacted by the pursuit of the so called Extrinsic Sources: money, status, and physical appearance. I believe this unrelenting idolatry towards the feeding of one self leads to ego-centrism, so I figured an appropriate antonym should name this new-founded ideology. Igocentrism also focuses on the liberation from religious belief, as in the societal definition of "religion". It is a deist approach to the existence of God - not necessarily atheist and yet open to the possibility of a non intellectual creator - which commends a utilitarian morality over an epistemological religious morality based on scripture. This group is intended for people who would like to learn more about igocentrism and hopefully find bliss in what could very possibly be the only finite life we have in this world.
results.name: I.G.O Society of Free Thinkers

results.description:
FAQs about Japa

What is Japa?

The Sanskrit word Japa means “to utter softly” and is a powerful method of meditation using Mantra (sound) in repetitive recitation.

What is the Purpose of Japa?

Japa, as a spiritual practice, uses sound vibration to transform the physiological and psychological make-up and nature of the practitioner. Increasingly studies are attesting to the powerful effects sound vibration has on our physical and emotional well-being.

What is a Mantra?

Mantra, which means “that which saves the mind” or “instruments of the mind”, is a collection of mathematically precise and melodic Sanskrit sound vibrations designed for specific energetic intentions.

Why is the Maha Mantra called the “great” Mantra?

This specific Mantra deemed “great” for two reasons: 1) it is one of very few mantras that combines both the feminine and masculine divinities simultaneously. 2) It can be chanted at any time and place.

What is the origin of the Maha Mantra?

This Mantra is found in the Kali-santara Upanishad, one of the 108 principle Upanishads, and was given by Brahma to the sage Narada.

What are the benefits of Japa Meditation?

Because the Maha Mantra combines both the feminine and masculine it is a Bhakti mantra or “mantra of loving relationships”. This works on transforming and improving the practitioner’s relationships on three levels - 1) Personal (relationship with oneself); 2) Interpersonal (relationships with others); and 3) Spiritual (relationship with the divine).

Why Japa Circles?

Japa Circles provide a powerful space in which the simultaneous recitation by all members amplifies the energy of the mantra exponentially.

What takes place at a Japa Circle?

For 15 minutes the practitioner fills out a four question survey and performs breathing and mindfulness exercises. For 30 minutes the actual Japa meditation takes place. Practitioners recite the mantra softly in rhythm and cadence with the instructor with increasingly relaxation and joy. The final 15 minutes is used for the concluding breathing exercises.

What is the purpose of the Survey?

Japa Circles and the various level s can only measure quantity of a practitioner’s Japa meditation. The purpose of the survey, which is private and for the practitioner’s personal use only, is to help measure the quality of a practitioner’s Japa meditation.

What is the purpose of the various levels?

The Maha Mantra was handed down with a recommendation that the practitioner recite the mantra 35 million times! The various levels are designed to give us impetus and inspiration. However, in the more mature stages of our personal development these levels become superfluous as the joy and transformation awakened by our Japa meditation becomes its own reward.
results.name: Japa (Mantra Meditation) Classes

results.description:
*** Friends of ENFJs are also welcome! ***

Are you and ENFJ? Depending on the statistic you look at, we make up between 2-4% of the population and are one of the rarest personality types.

We have been called 'The Protagonist', 'The Giver', 'The Teacher' and 'The Cult Leader' (which of course we would never actually do, but we totally 100% could-- right?).

We are social chameleons who are comfortable in almost any situation. We are different things to different people. We mirror, we flirt (at least thats how others view it, really we just like making others feel good).

We make our opinions heard and we do it in a productive way that will most likely sway the opinions of others while avoiding hurt feelings.

We are good friends, good listeners, exceptionally open while at the same time extraordinarily private when it comes to revealing our true selves.

We have deep wells of emotion for those people and causes we care for, and insight into the thoughts, feelings and motivations of those around us.

We often feel that others don't 'get' us and have on occasion resigned ourselves to that feeling of being alone in a crowded room.

Well, lets change that! Rare as we may be, we are certainly out there. Let's meet up (probably at a bar or coffee shop), socialize, and dig into just how similar we actually are.
results.name: Boston ENFJ Meetup

Whatever level of research and studies you are, for as long as you are hungry for knowledge and want to be on the toe when it comes to being updated with latest research findings, this group is for you.

It is a very relaxed and informal set up which aims to initiate a peer support group transcending across educational institutes. If you are starting a grad school, or in the mid-level and cannot move forward with your thesis or a professional researcher who wants to get out and discuss her/his ideas we will be here to listen and comment on your work. 

This group is intended for scholars, students, professionals interested in the latest of sciences who'd like to share their research and meet likeminded people. We invite people from across all disciplines to come and connect with fellow scholars/students in town. 

This is a great set up as it puts you beyond your university collegial space. Besides, being in Boston - a city of educational institutes, it only makes sense to reach out on a chilled and relaxed evening and network with people of similar interests. 

We could start sharing our project ideas and get feedbacks, organize writing retreats, comment on each others work, seminars on how to get published, reading groups, hosting talks, tutoring and teaching (for those scared of teaching super smart students, do not worry we all have gone/are going through). So let's meet and create an informal but robust peer-support group athwart grasping with ongoing research advancements in our discipline. Watching documentary is under discussion! It'd be great!


Besides, if you want to gossip or share your frustration of being a grad student or a researcher, I am sure you won't be alone to have those thoughts ;)

results.description: This is not a writing group. It is an opportunity for authors to work on Phase II: the phase after finishing your literary masterpiece. If you're an Indie author, you probably already know that writing is only half the work. The other half is promoting, advertising, practicing the elevator pitch, using keywords on your book description, etc. It's the part of being an author that most of us don't like but is just as important as good writing to increase book sales. If you want to dig in and get motivated, this group is for you. We'll be talking about everything that increase sales from getting honest reviews on sites like Amazon and Goodreads to tracking advertising efforts and their results. There is nothing shameful about being proud of your book and working hard to share it with the world. There is nothing shameful about trying to make a return on your year's of labor and time spent honing your skills. In this group you won't ever have to apologize for promoting your book, in fact, it is a prerequisite for membership. Just be prepared to share what you learn with our other members.
results.name: Shameless Book Marketing for Indie Authors

results.description: This free meetup group is open to any creative writer of any level. Past participants have ranged from the curious beginner to widely published authors. The format began in El Paso Texas over 20 years ago when poet Donna Snyder formed the Tumblewords Writers Project. A presenter delivers a 5-10 minute experience designed to inspire a written response in any form. Participants write for 10-15 minutes then each person reads the unfiltered writing out loud. There is no critique. There is no editing. There is 100% acceptance of the "in the moment efforts" of each participant. Each particiant leaves with a set of inspirations which they can process and refine outside of the workshop. Each session lasts 2 hours and there are usually 2 - 4 opportunities to respond, write and read out loud. We currently meet at the Marblehead Library.
results.name: Tumblewords East : A Northshore Creative Writing Meetup

results.description:
Start the New Year on a high note! Come sing with the Wakefield Choral Society! All voices and musical abilities are welcome to join this friendly, enthusiastic and talented group of singers. We rehearse Monday nights, 7 to 9, at the Wakefield High School - 60 Farm Street, Wakefield, MA - starting on January 4, 2016 and offer three well-attended and well-reviewed concerts annually: spring, fall and winter. 


American Songbook, contemporary, classical, gospel, ethnic, and sacred - we enjoy preparing and performing a wide repertoire of musical genres. Our conductor brings the perfect combination of musical skill, knowledge, and people skills to the group. 


To join: just attend one of three "open rehearsals" starting on January 4, 2016 at 7.00 p.m. There is no audition - just come and enjoy an evening of song and fun!  

Should you decide to join the chorus, dues are 65.00 per semester or 130.00 per year.


For more information: - We'd love to hear from you: please let us know your thoughts and questions! - We are looking for not only singers, but those interested in providing instrumentals and support such as box office, donor recruitment, fund raising, etc. - Visit our website and FaceBook pages: http://www.wakefieldmachoralsociety.org https://www.facebook.com/wakefieldchoralsociety.
results.name: Wakefield Choral Society

results.description: Maintaining healthy behaviors in a world of drive-thru fast food and modern conveniences that allow us to stay sedentary can be very difficult! Join Jenny Berk, a Certified Eating Psychology Coach, weekly to navigate the waters of our modern day culture to hone our skills in leading a healthy lifestyle for years to come! Jenny takes a kind and gentle approach to both weight loss and weight maintenance, fitness and healthy behaviors. She will utilize mind/body nutrition concepts, Dynamic eating psychology techniques along with support and accountability to help people make and/or sustain healthy eating and movement practices. Each week will feature a new theme topic to discuss and homework assignments given for accountability. This group is casual and will be held in the beautiful yoga space at Samadhi in Newton Center. Weekly drop-in rate of $20 is requested. Come join us and move towards a path of peace and happiness with your food choices and your body.
results.name: Wellness and weight maintenance support at Samadhi -Newton

If you're interested in the future of our country and enjoy Breitbart.com, this meetup is the place for you!  The dress is casual, the events are free, and the friendships we’ll form will be long-lasting.

“Walk toward the fire. Don’t worry about what they call you. All those things are said against you because they want to stop you in your tracks.
